qas.question: What type of imaging was used to study the relationship between humans and dogs?

An MRI study on dogs proved that dogs use the same parts of what as humans?
Because dogs respond to voices the same way humans do, they are able to recognize what in human sounds, making them social?
What technology was used to show that dogs respond to voices in the same brain parts as people?
Dogs have the ability to recognize what type of human sounds?

context: The latest study using <a0_0>magnetic resonance imaging<a0_0/> (<a4_0>MRI<a4_0/>) to humans and dogs together proved that dogs have same response to <a1_0>voices<a1_0/> and use the same parts of <a2_0>the brain<a2_0/> as humans to do so. This gives dogs the ability to recognize <a3_0><a5_0>emotion<a3_0/>al<a5_0/> human sounds, making them friendly social pets to humans.
